org.rdkit.knime.nodes.mcs

Class RDKitMCSNodeModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • NodeModel
      • org.rdkit.knime.nodes.AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        • org.rdkit.knime.nodes.mcs.RDKitMCSNodeModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RDKitObjectCleaner

    public class RDKitMCSNodeModel
extends AbstractRDKitNodeModel
    This class implements the node model of the RDKitMCS node providing calculations based on the open source RDKit library.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        protected DataTableSpec[] configure(DataTableSpec[] inSpecs)
                             throws InvalidSettingsException
        Should be called before the own implementation starts its work. This clears all warnings from the warning consolidator and checks the error state of the native RDKit library.
        Overrides:
        configure in class AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException

      • createInputDataInfos

        protected InputDataInfo[] createInputDataInfos(int inPort,
                                               DataTableSpec inSpec)
                                        throws InvalidSettingsException
        This implementation generates input data info object for the input mol column and connects it with the information coming from the appropriate setting model. This method needs to be implemented by a concrete node to generate InputDataInfo objects for each input column for all input tables. To find the proper column, the concrete node implementation must pass in the appropriate setting model of the column name into the constructor of the InputDataInfo class.
        Specified by:
        createInputDataInfos in class AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        Parameters:
        inPort - The port number of the input table to create input data objects for.
        inSpec - The table specification of the input table. Can be null.
        Returns:
        An array of info objects for all columns used as input for the passed table. Should not return null. If no input columns are used from the passed table, it should return an empty array.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the current settings or the spec of the input table will make it impossible to process the data.

      • getOutputTableSpec

        protected DataTableSpec getOutputTableSpec(int outPort,
                                           DataTableSpec[] inSpecs)
                                    throws InvalidSettingsException
        Returns the output table specification of the specified out port.
        Specified by:
        getOutputTableSpec in class AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        Parameters:
        outPort - Index of output port in focus. Zero-based.
        inSpecs - All input table specifications.
        Returns:
        The specification of all output tables.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the settings are inconsistent with given DataTableSpec elements.
        See Also:
        #createOutputFactories(int)

      • processing

        protected BufferedDataTable[] processing(BufferedDataTable[] inData,
                                         InputDataInfo[][] arrInputDataInfo,
                                         ExecutionContext exec)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This method gets called from the method AbstractRDKitNodeModel.execute(BufferedDataTable[], ExecutionContext) to perform the main work of the node. It is equivalent to the original KNIME execute method. However, in this implementation the execute method acts more like a director to coordinate pre-, core and post-processing and to cleanup RDKit objects at the end. Hence, it should not be overridden. Instead a developer would override this method.
        Specified by:
        processing in class AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        Parameters:
        inData - The input tables of the node.
        arrInputDataInfo - Information about all columns of the input tables.
        exec - The execution context, which was derived as sub-execution context. Track the progress from 0..1.
        Returns:
        The result tables to be passed to the method AbstractRDKitNodeModel.postProcessing(BufferedDataTable[], InputDataInfo[][], BufferedDataTable[], ExecutionContext). If this method is not overridden these are the same tables that will be returned by the method AbstractRDKitNodeModel.execute(BufferedDataTable[], ExecutionContext) as the final result tables.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown, if post-processing fails.
